item.title: Vladimir Putin “props up” Alexander Lukashenko’s regime, says @Tsihanouskaya. “The West’s weakness has led to Belarus becoming an accomplice in the most brutal European conflict since the second world war” https://t.co/26ZhqEFrAZ

“We believe in victory. It’s impossible to believe in anything else.” Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelensky, speaks to The Economist’s editor-in-chief @zannymb and Russia editor @arkadyostrovsky, on a special episode of “The Economist Asks” podcast https://t.co/b10socDcxz

The Economist’s editor-in-chief, Zanny Minton Beddoes, travelled to the heart of the Ukrainian war effort to interview Volodymyr Zelensky.
In a wide-ranging interview, the Ukrainian president discussed the state of the war and why Putin must be defeated https://t.co/dmx8o1aGfr
